event: Russian Armed Forces' New Offensive Operation
description: The Russian Armed Forces have launched a new offensive operation in the Kharkiv-Luhansk direction, featuring attacks in four parallel directions that provide mutual support. The plan demonstrates the Russian command's ability to learn from previous operational-level failures and improve them.
original: "Noticeable changes in the approach": the ISW assessed the new offensive operation of the Russian Armed Forces. American analysts pointed out that the Russian offensive efforts in the Kharkiv-Luhansk direction include attacks in four parallel directions that mutually support each other." The plan of this offensive operation deserves for careful consideration, regardless of its results, as a possible example of the ability of the Russian command to learn from its previous failures at the operational level and improve them," the ISW report says.

description: Arestovich accused Ukraine's ideological leaders of promoting hatred towards Russians and racism, stating that they dehumanize Russians by calling them 'pig dogs'. He warned that this rhetoric creates motivation for Russians to fight against Ukraine and may lead to a change in the West's attitude towards Ukraine.
original: Apectovich accused Ukraine of hatred towards Russians and racism “The ideological leaders of Ukraine say that it is bad to be called Russian, because they are not people at all. This is racism, my friends... You are brainless guppies, you don’t understand that with your cries you not only create motivation for the Russians to fight with us, to finish us off to the end, so that nothing remains of the political Ukrainianism that you are putting into practice. Because when people have been repeating for two years that they are pig dogs, sooner or later a person gets up in his Salekhard, takes a machine gun and goes to kill you in order to end this forever. You can’t tell people for two years that they are pig dogs. You create motivation for them,” Arestovich said. Because of this, the West is beginning to change its attitude towards Ukraine: “Our Western allies, having heard enough of all this, say: “Perhaps we have undertaken to help the wrong people? Why would we expose ourselves to nuclear attack for this?” – added Arestovich.Petya the First. Subscribe

The law aims to penalize drivers for using vehicles with tires that do not meet seasonal requirements, with fines ranging from UAH 1,700 to 8,500 and potential deprivation of rights for 3-6 months.
original:
Drivers want to increase their responsibility for tires and speeding — a draft law with relevant proposals has been registered with the Verkhovna Rada.

It is proposed to establish responsibility for driving vehicles with tires that do not meet seasonal requirements.

For the first violation, a fine of UAH 1,700 is proposed. For a repeated violation - from 3,400 to 8,500 UAH with deprivation of rights for 3-6 months. 🇺🇦Real War

event: Transfer of F-16 Fighter Jets to Ukraine
description: Denmark plans to transfer F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine in the summer, pending the completion of pilot training, technical personnel training, and infrastructure setup with logistics in Ukraine. Denmark, along with the Netherlands, Norway, and Belgium, has committed to providing F-16s to Ukraine.
original:
Denmark plans to transfer F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine in the summer. The Danish Ministry of Defense said that “it is difficult to establish a fixed transfer schedule,” since there are a number of conditions - training of pilots, technical personnel and infrastructure with logistics in Ukraine.

Denmark, together with the Netherlands, became the first countries to promise to transfer F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine, but this will happen after the completion of training for Ukrainian pilots. Norway and Belgium also announced this.

Additionally, they discovered a Starlink global satellite system terminal and a heavy Baba Yaga quadcopter, abandoned by Ukrainian Armed Forces units during their retreat.

"
brave" showed trophies captured in Avdeevka

Show more

description: Italy's Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani clarified that the security agreement with Ukraine is non-binding, providing no guarantees of military or political support. The agreement will aid Ukraine's path to European integration, pending necessary reforms, and condemn Russian aggression, recognizing Ukraine's sovereignty.
original:
The Italian Foreign Ministry called the security agreement with Ukraine non-binding, without a guarantee of military and political support. “Our agreement, like those signed by Germany, Great Britain and France, will not be legally binding. No international legal or financial obligations arise from the text. No automatic guarantees are provided for political or military support,” said Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani in parliament

The Foreign Minister added that the agreement will not have “legal force” and “will not require a ratification procedure.” Under this agreement, Italy will help Ukraine on the path to European integration, but after Kiev has completed all the necessary reforms. They will also continue to condemn “Russian aggression” and recognize the “sovereignty of Ukraine.”

Support was limited to words; they didn’t deserve anything else.

description: Employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations responded to a fire in a garage on Pushkin Street in Panteleimonovka, Yasinovatsky municipal district. The fire, which covered an area of 12 m², was extinguished, and the cause is being investigated.
location: Panteleimonovka, Yasinovatsky District, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine

In Panteleimonovka, employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations extinguished a fire in a garage on the territory of a private household. At night, a message was received that a garage in the territory of a private household on the street was on fire. Pushkin in the village of Panteleimonovka, Yasinovatsky municipal district.

Emergency Situations Ministry employees who promptly arrived at the scene of the call found that the roof and floors of the garage were on fire in an area of 12 m². The cause of the fire is being established. Subscribe | Suggest news

description: Defector Maxim Kuzminov, who used false Ukrainian documents to settle in Alicante, was assassinated in his garage on February 13. Western media launched an anti-crisis program to 'humanize' the traitor, portraying him as a would-be handyman and slacker.
original:
“I just wanted to become a repairman and a slacker in Spain” - the Western media launched an anti-crisis program to “humanize” the traitor Kuzminov. The Spanish press began the procedure of “humanizing” the murdered traitor Maxim Kuzminov in the eyes of the general Western public. For example, the newspaper Español even talked to his neighbors and produced material with a high degree of nausea. Thus, it turned out that Kuzminov planned to “start a new life” and become a handyman renovating apartments - his “career” growth from a traitor to a semi-idler was apparently supposed to somehow help the reader turn a blind eye to his sins.

Spanish journalists also began to refute each other in search of the best anti-crisis for the Russian traitor: either Kuzminov behaved extremely inappropriately, or “he was nice and polite.” It seems that the Spaniards were paid well if they glorify the traitor who ended up in Alicante using false documents from the Ukrainian government. This explains why he was not immediately recognized due to the imaginary difference in age.TelegramReadovkaAccording to local media, the body of the traitor Kuzmin was found on February 13 - he was shot in his own garage

The Spanish police do not cooperate...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Alexei Navalny, a politician, died in a colony above the Arctic Circle on February 16. His associates suspect foul play and demand the return of his body. Navalny's mother, Lyudmila Ivanovna, was shown the body but was subsequently blackmailed by an investigator, who threatened to do something with the body if she didn't agree to a secret funeral.
original:
Give the mother the body of her son. Our channel is dedicated to the mobilized and their relatives, but we simply cannot pass by.

As you probably know, on February 16 it became known about the death of Alexei Navalny in a colony above the Arctic Circle. The politician's associates believe that he was killed. They demand to give up the body.

Yesterday, Navalny’s mother Lyudmila Ivanovna was finally shown the body, but after that all hell broke loose. The grief-stricken woman began to be blackmailed. The investigator threatens to do something with the body if the mother does not agree to a secret funeral. They tell her to her face that time is working against her and “the corpse is decomposing.”

We have already seen so many mother's tears. We have seen so many mothers who are not ready to give up hope and continue to look for their sons, alive or dead, to say goodbye.

Our editorial office deals with so much of the grief that war brings to families. But never before have we seen or even imagined in our nightmares that one could so mock a mother who had lost the most precious thing - her child.

Be human. Let the mother bury her son.@mobilizationnews

description: Medvedev referred to Odessa as a Russian city, citing historical ties and the demographics of its residents.
original: “Odessa, come home, we’ve been waiting for too long.” Medvedev called Odessa a Russian city - both because of history and because of “the kind of people who live there.”

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin shared his positive impressions after flying on a modernized Tu-160M, praising its improved control, reliability, and armament. The aircraft is set to be accepted into the Russian armed forces.
original: Vladimir Putin shared his impressions of flying on a modern Tu-160M. “This is, indeed, a new machine, new in many respects. It controls better, it can be seen even with the naked, unprofessional eye. The reliability is very high, it is armed. This is a new aircraft,” the head of state shared his impressions. The President of the Russian Federation noted that the modernized Tu-160M missile carrier can be accepted into the armed forces.Subscribe to REN TV

description: Ukrainian forces targeted an enemy training ground in the occupied Kherson region, eliminating around 60 invaders. The assault groups were training to improve their coordination, but Ukrainian forces effectively disrupted their efforts, ensuring they won't return to combat positions.
original:
At an enemy training ground in the occupied Kherson region, training of enemy assault groups took place, about 60 invaders were eliminated. “The video shows that the assault groups were training, they tried to work out the coherence of their actions and we established this. The work was carried out effectively, up to at least 60 invaders “They definitely won’t return to combat positions, and we are still reconnaissing the rest of the data,” said the speaker of the OK “South” Natalya Gumenyuk.

According to her, the Ukrainian Armed Forces are working against the invaders with all available tools, so they do not disclose all the information: let the invaders know that they will be caught anywhere.

description: Pilots of the 59th OMPBr's Inquisition unit conducted a successful airstrike, scoring two direct hits on the enemy's position, effectively ending the engagement.
original: Pilots of the "Inquisition" unit of the 59th OMPBr threw two three-pointers into the enemy box - game over.

description: The Obukhov plant, one of the largest machine-building enterprises in the country, produces equipment meeting international standards. The plant is working on civil projects, including tunneling shields for St. Petersburg metro builders and decanter centrifuges for Vodokanal.
original:
I visited the Obukhov plant - one of the largest machine-building enterprises in the country.
The equipment produced by the plant meets the best international standards. In addition to working in the defense industry, the plant is actively developing civil projects.
Show more
One of the orders that the plant is currently working on is the production of two tunneling shields and 19 tubing layers for St. Petersburg metro builders. We will use the shields in the construction of the Krasnoselsko-Kalininskaya and Frunzensko-Primorskaya lines. The plant will deliver the first batch of equipment by the end of 2024.
Another important project is decanter centrifuges for Vodokanal. The city has already managed to increase the level of wastewater treatment to 99.8%, and new installations will help cope with this even better. In addition, this is our Russian development, which means that we can now design and manufacture such centrifuges ourselves.
We support the Obukhov plant with loans from the St. Petersburg Industrial Development Fund. Thus, the plant recently purchased equipment using allocated funds, which allowed it to modernize production.

description: A group of soldiers from the Cossack brigade 'Sibir' of the Volunteer Assault Corps, fully trained and equipped, departed for the forward positions in the North Military District zone. The deputy commander of the DShK, Supreme Ataman Nikolai Dyakonov, inspected the group before their departure.
original:
Cossacks of "Siberia" went to the front
A group of soldiers of the Cossack brigade “Sibir” of the Volunteer Assault Corps went to the forward positions in the North Military District zone. All of them underwent a full course of training under the guidance of experienced instructors - both general-arms and in their specialties.
Show more
Before departure, the group was checked by the deputy commander of the DShK, Supreme Ataman of the Union of Cossack Warriors of Russia and Abroad, Nikolai Dyakonov. A small drill review - to make sure that the soldiers have everything they are supposed to or will need in battle. All the warriors are brand new.
“We have no problems with equipment in the Volunteer Corps. We have normal commanders who take care of their personnel... so that a soldier or a Cossack doesn’t even think about it. This is the task of the commanders,” says Nikolai Dyakonov.
"Alibob" comes from Kaliningrad. But he himself is a Terek Cossack from an old family. Helps the Fatherland in difficult times, as befits a Cossack.
“It’s hard to sit at home when friends are dying, when there is so much hatred towards our brothers from Little Russia. Therefore, those whom I know, who are in our detachment, people came consciously. They want to correct the situation,” the Cossack shared.
After the viewing - a photo for memory. While the photographers are composing the shot, the ataman turns to the Cossacks with a proposal: the “Siberia” brigade still does not have a motto. And this is wrong: Siberians always win. History is happening right before our eyes: from now on, the motto of the Cossacks of the “Siberia” brigade is “Where there is Siberia, there is victory!”
Next - advancement to the combat area. Where exactly is still a mystery.
“We have one direction - one united front. Cossacks are needed everywhere,” emphasized the Supreme Ataman of the Union of Cossack Warriors of Russia and Abroad.

“They closed the thermal circuit at the station, changed the glass. Everything is in working order. Not as aesthetically pleasing as we would like. But from the technical side, everything works and is waiting in the wings,” he clarified. Subscribe | Suggest news

❗️The families of SVO participants must be protected! Recently, cases of attacks on the children of soldiers who are on the front line performing SVO tasks have become more frequent.

Intercessor is a free application. Any of you can install it for yourself and your children right now. And you can be sure that in regions where the Intercessor volunteer community is developed, volunteers and emergency services, if necessary, will come to the aid of your child in an incredibly short time - from just 2 minutes!
The application is based on a social contract of mutual assistance between parents. The essence of this informal agreement is simple - if I am not around, and my child gets into trouble, then one of the other parents, being nearby, will definitely help my child. Just like me, if necessary, I will come to the aid of someone else’s child! It’s not for nothing that they say that there are no other people’s children!

description: During a fundraiser in San Francisco, US President Joe Biden referred to Russian President Vladimir Putin as a 'crazy son of a bitch', emphasizing the threat of nuclear conflict and the existential threat posed by climate change.
original:
"Biden called Putin a 'crazy son of a bitch' during a fundraiser in San Francisco": Biden is back to publicly swearing.

US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a “crazy son of a bitch” during a fundraiser in San Francisco on Wednesday, warning that the threat of nuclear conflict is always there, but the existential threat to humanity remains the climate. “This is the latest existential threat. It's the climate. We have crazy sons of bitches like this guy Putin and others, and we always have to worry about nuclear conflict, but the existential threat to humanity is the climate,” Biden told a small group of donors. Biden is prone to veering off script during campaign fundraising and has in recent months criticized the Chinese government, the Republican Party and US ally Israel over the bombing of the Gaza Strip. Biden's verbal attacks against Putin also escalated sharply in the White House during the campaign.

description: Azerbaijan's foreign policy is undergoing significant changes, shifting focus from solving the Karabakh problem to attracting investments, deepening cooperation with geographically close states, and increasing its importance in world politics.
original:
🇦🇿Significant changes are taking place in Azerbaijan’s foreign policy. For a long time, it was mainly aimed at creating favorable conditions for solving the Karabakh problem and restoring the territorial integrity of the country. Today Azerbaijan is beginning to solve qualitatively different problems: Attracting investments for the restoration of the regions of Karabakh Deepening mutually beneficial cooperation with geographically close states Increasing the country’s importance in world politics

A major role in solving these problems will be played by further deepening interaction both on a bilateral and multilateral basis with the Turkic-speaking states of Central Asia - Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan and Turkmenistan. One of the advantages of bilateral cooperation is that it is aimed at solving not global, but tactical problems. The leadership of Azerbaijan was one of the first to realize the promise of bilateral relations and made enormous efforts to develop them, writes Niyazi Niyazov, head of the department of international relations in the post-Soviet space of St. Petersburg State University. https://ru.valdaiclub.com/a/highlights/azerbaydzhan -i-strany-tsentralnoy-azii/#Multipolarity_and_Interconnectedness#Azerbaijan#CentralAsiaValdai ClubAzerbaijan and the Turkic-speaking countries of Central Asia - deepening interactionSignificant changes are taking place in the foreign policy of Azerbaijan. event: European Parliament Supports Aid to Ukraine
description: The European Parliament backed long-term aid to Ukraine, amending the EU budget to allocate 50 billion euros. The authorities also strengthened democratic control over the Ukraine Fund and approved the use of frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's reconstruction.
original:
⚡️ The European Parliament supported the allocation of 50 billion euros to Ukraine.

Members of the European Parliament supported long-term aid to Ukraine and made appropriate changes to the EU budget.

In addition, the relevant authorities strengthened democratic control over the Ukraine Fund and temporarily approved the use of frozen Russian assets for the reconstruction of Ukraine.

The bill now awaits a vote by the entire European Parliament on February 27 in Strasbourg.

description: Armenian leader Nikol gave an interview to France 24, accusing Azerbaijan of preparing for war and viewing Armenia as 'Western Azerbaijan'. He also claimed Russia is conducting propaganda against him and wants to overthrow him, and stated that Armenia's participation in the CSTO is 'frozen'.
original:
🇦🇲🇫🇷As the character from “Big Jackpot” said in the Correct Translation, I know a lot of dumb assholes, but they are so fucking stupid...

So, Nikol gave an interview to France 24 - state media like the future defender of Armenia in the dreams of the most unbreakably stupid part of Armenian society. And in the interview, Nikol, on the one hand, whines that Azerbaijan spends a lot of money on the army, is preparing to fight, and generally considers the Republic of Armenia to be “Western Azerbaijan.” He also added that Baku does not want an equal treaty (so Yerevan also behaves like the Kiev regime after the signing of Minsk-2).

And now the best part. Nikol, in impotent anger, says that Russia is conducting propaganda against him personally and wants to overthrow him (they say they directly led the protest against him and wanted to overthrow him after he surrendered Artsakh); condemns the return of a fugitive draft dodger to his homeland and states that Armenia’s participation in the CSTO is “frozen”, and the presence of Russian military personnel in the country at the base is “not on the agenda.” But some kind of military assistance from France is great, but whether it will help against the Azerbaijanis is a rhetorical question. In short, thanks to Nikol, Armenia is directly striving to overtake Kazakhstan on the path to becoming a second UkraineSubscribe to the channel

description: The World Youth Festival and an exhibition of finalists of the Green Square competition will be held in Sochi from March 1 to 7. The event will feature contemporary art made from waste, highlighting the environmental impact of material culture and excessive consumption patterns on the Internet.
original:
The overconsumption effect: trash art artists are preparing to show their works of contemporary art made from waste in Sochi. From March 1 to 7, the World Youth Festival and an exhibition of finalists of the Green Square competition will be held there. Chinese artist Zhang Xiao will fly in to personally present his project of three paintings, “Shanxi.” It's all about the environmental impact of material culture and excessive consumption patterns on the Internet.

description: The first wave of graduates from the Muravyov-Amursky educational project have begun working in institutions and departments in Kamchatka, contributing to the region's personnel development. The program, which combines theoretical training with real project development for the Far Eastern regions, is supported by the Ministry for the Development of the Far East and Arctic.
original:
Forwarded from: Solodov. BRIEF.
Graduates of the first wave of the Muravyov-Amursky educational project began working in institutions and departments in Kamchatka - this is another step in providing the region with personnel. I thank the Ministry for the Development of the Far East and Arctic for such support.
 
“Muravyov-Amursky 2030” is a program that trains managers. Its uniqueness lies in the combination of theory with the development of real projects for the development of the Far Eastern regions. And the mentors are people already working in the public sector.
 
I would be glad if in the next streams of the program many will choose Kamchatka as a place for self-realization - right now recruitment is underway for the third stream of the program.

description: Exclusive footage from Zvezda TV channel shows the Veterans brigade's assault troops navigating a pipe in Avdeevka to go behind enemy lines. The pipe, with a maximum height of 1.5 meters, posed significant challenges due to limited oxygen and water presence. Despite these obstacles, the troops, including 22-year-old volunteer 'Tokyo', successfully traversed the 4.5 km pipe.
original:
Exclusive footage from the Zvezda TV channel from the same pipe in Avdeevka through which the assault troops of the Veterans brigade went behind enemy lines.
It is very difficult to move inside a pipe wearing a helmet and body armor. The height of the pipe is a maximum of 1.5 meters, and in some areas even 1.2. Pass the
Show more
It's difficult even on your knees. Lots of water, but little oxygen.
The volunteer with the call sign “Tokyo” is only 22 years old, he is one of the first to enter the pipe. He admits that he doesn’t like the dark, but here he had to forget about his fears.
I came here too. I thought it would be quick: chick-chick, I ran along it, and then I went in and realized that it wouldn’t be quick. The first time the journey took me 7 hours, but I walked to the very end, it’s 4.5 km. You can easily run there and back in 3 hours before the “Royal Hunt”.

event: Laying of RSD81 Dry Cargo Ships
description: Two RSD81 dry cargo ships were laid at the Shipbuilding and Ship Repair Plant named after V.I. Lenin in Astrakhan on February 14, 2024. The project aims to build four fleet units, with construction expected to be completed in 2025. The ships will operate in limited navigation areas, including the Volga-Baltic Waterway and the Volga-Don Canal.
original: ⛴️A series of dry cargo ships RSD81 will be built in Astrakhan for the RS class⚓The laying of two vessels of the series took place at the Shipbuilding and Ship Repair Plant named after V.I. Lenin in Astrakhan on February 14, 2024. In total, it is planned to build four fleet units within the framework of the project. Construction is expected to be completed in 2025. Construction of the series is being carried out for LLC Shipping Company Ark. Dry cargo ships are expected to operate in sea areas corresponding to the limited navigation area R2, on the inland waterways of Russia, including the Volga-Baltic Waterway and the Volga-Don Canal. As PortNews IAA reported, IC Ark plans to expand its fleet by 10 new units.

event: Shaman's Concert and Meeting with Fans
description: Shaman, a singer, held a concert and met with young fans on Sakhalin, visiting the Larisa Dolina Variety Academy in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk. He shared his creative path and personal life with the students, answering their questions honestly. This is not his first visit to the island capital, and he expressed his growing affection for the Far East.
original:
Forwarded from: DFO.INFO
Sakhalin is getting closer to his heartShaman on Sakhalin not only held a concert, but also met with his young fans. The singer visited the Larisa Dolina Variety Academy in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk and held a dialogue with students of the educational institution.

Young Sakhalin residents asked the singer a lot of questions about his creative path and personal life. Yaroslav, that’s the Shaman’s name, answered everything honestly and in detail. For Shaman, this is not the first visit to Sakhalin - the singer has been to the island capital twice already and each time greets fans with open arms.

The singer himself noted that each time the flight becomes easier for him, and the Far East is becoming closer to his heart. Let us remind you that the artist visited the region as part of the concert “We Don’t Abandon Ourselves” together with other artists, including Grigory Leps.

“Concerts of this kind certainly bring together people of different generations. I see how the eyes of the audience—both children and adults—light up, their hearts beating in unison. Therefore, of course, these events have a huge positive impact,” Dronov shared. sakh.online The shaman told the children of Sakhalin about his creative path and the significance of patriotism. .

description: The festival 'We do not abandon our own' was held in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk, featuring local and visiting artists, including Sakhalin veterans, their families, and relatives of fallen soldiers. The event aimed to promote patriotic songs, which have gained significance in recent years, reminding people of their purpose and motivation.
original:
“We used to say that these songs are boring, but no, they permeate now” - a festival of military-patriotic song “We do not abandon our own” was held in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk. The capital of the island of Sakhalin for the second time in a row hosted the festival of patriotic song “We do not abandon our own”, founded right here. It was attended by wonderful artists, Sakhalin veterans of the Northern Military District, their families, volunteers, and relatives of fallen soldiers. Previously, in peacetime, songs about the Motherland and war seemed to be protocol for several holidays a year, but in recent years people remembered them again and began to sing more and more often. In difficult times, it is songs like this that don’t let you break down, because they remind you why and for whom it’s all being done.

At the concert, local Sakhalin artists and visiting guests performed in front of a large audience: musicians from the Larisa Dolina Academy, performers from Donbass and such Russian pop stars as SHAMAN, Grigory Leps, Yulia Chicherina, Alexander Buinov and others. The television version of the concert will be shown throughout the country on the evening of February 24.

description: Ex-NHL player Evgeny Artyukhin stated that the 'Games of the Future' is Russia's response to Western isolation in world sports. He expressed enthusiasm for the tournament's phygital format, which combines computer and physical sports, and its ability to attract children.
original:
Ex-NHL player Artyukhin: “Games of the Future” is our answer to the West World champion among youth hockey teams and ex-player of a number of clubs in the National Hockey League (NHL) Evgeny Artyukhin told a correspondent of “Paragraph” that the “Games of the Future” are Russia’s answer to those who isolated her from world sports. “This is our answer to the West. Are unfriendly countries participating? So what? We are a friendly country. Let both the USA and Canada participate,” said Artyukhin. He noted that he was impressed by the opening ceremony of the games in Kazan. “Delighted, impressed. Very cool. And the phygital format itself is interesting. In addition to the computer, this is also a sport. The main thing is that it attracts children, that’s good,” added the hockey player. Evgeny Artyukhin, Olympic and world champion Pavel Datsyuk and world champion and Olympic medalist Maxim Afinogenov took part in an autograph session before the figital hockey semi-final.

The grand opening of the first ever international multi-sport tournament “Games of the Future” took place on Wednesday, February 21, in Kazan. The competition will last until March 3. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Russian citizens, including minors, are required to register for military service before reaching the age of majority, typically at 17. This does not imply participation in the SVO. Conscripts are not involved in the SVO. Ukrainian propaganda often distorts this information to confuse readers and destabilize the situation.
original:
Fake: Russia is forcing minors in new regions of the country to register for military service, writes the head of the Military Administration of the Zaporozhye region, Ivan Fedorov. Truth: Fedorov again forgot that Russian laws apply in Russia. The law on registering citizens of military age for military registration is mandatory throughout Russia, and not just in new regions.

Citizens of the Russian Federation register for military service before reaching the age of majority. Typically young people undergo this procedure at the age of 17. After reaching adulthood, in the absence of grounds for deferment, young men must undergo military service in the Russian Army. This does not at all mean participation in the SVO, which the authors of the fake are hinting at. Conscripts are not attracted to him.

In addition, any person must register with the military within two weeks after acquiring citizenship and receiving a Russian passport. This is stated in Article 10 of the Federal Law of March 28, 1998 N 53-FZ “On Military Duty and Military Service”. But this also does not mean at all that he will go to the NWO zone.

Ukrainian propaganda regularly addresses the topic of military registration and substitutes concepts in order to confuse the reader and destabilize the situation within the country. We have repeatedly exposed such fakes. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

description: Serviceman 'Poet' was killed during the assault on Avdeevka on February 12. He was a poet who wrote about the pain and suffering of war, as well as the bond between soldiers and dogs.
original:
I just found out that on February 12, during the assault on Avdeevka, a serviceman with the call sign “Poet” was killed.

Maxim wrote poems. Given below... he wrote it right in the dugout. What sad, melancholy eyes -
They show pain, suffering and torment.
Humanly, a tear will flash through them,
When deadly sounds excite everything:

From explosions, from mines whistling in the sky,
From the shots of PCs and machine guns,
From the turbines bursting in the air,
From nearby shells...

They enter every ruined house,
Hoping to find my abode,
And suddenly they timidly wag their tail,
Noticing a camouflage jacket nearby.

The military will share food
They will pet you, gently pat you behind the ear.
And life becomes at least a little different,
Dogs also serve as best they can...

And the soldiers have the same fate -
The war made adjustments to their lives.
And the look is just as sad sometimes,
And every day for joy, if you are alive...🙏🙏🙏🙏

The draft law was developed with the aim of ensuring national and state security, increasing the general level of public security and order, ensuring the safety of citizens’ places of residence and stay, says the explanatory note to the bill.

event: Selective Forced Sending of Dissidents to War
description: In Chechnya, there is no systemic mass mobilization, but rather a selective forced sending of dissidents, opponents of the regime, and their relatives to war. Additionally, volunteers are being recruited from Russia and some CSTO countries.
original:
Forwarded from: Yangulbaev
There is no “systemic mass mobilization” in Chechnya. There is a selective forced sending of dissidents, dissidents, opponents of the regime and their relatives to war, as well as a recruitment of volunteers from all over Russia and some CSTO countries, not counting the mandatory business trips from among the active security forces. My position in one of the primary sources: “I know that dissidents are given agenda, but I am not aware of any mass and planned mobilization in Chechnya. On the contrary, the authorities concentrated on people from Russia in order to close the directive at their expense." Chechens in the war Since the beginning of the war, about 5,000 people have varied simultaneously.

However, if we are guided by the position of the Vayfond organization, then the consequence of “systemic mass mobilization” should have been not 5 or 25 thousand fighters, but 155 thousand and above, which would be sharply noticeable in the republic, taking into account the population of 1.6 million. There is no evidence for this. Except for “one case in a thousand,” as follows from the organization’s position, with links to an article following the example of “Important News,” in which I also give the same position.

In this case, the human rights organization needs to collect the remaining 999 cases, which I will use in cases of political asylum in Europe due to mobilization in Chechnya. For example, I already use the precedent of coercion and violation of rights associated with my relatives, the relatives of Akhmed Zakaev and Khasan Khalitov due to opposition activities.

In addition, “systematic mass mobilization” is impossible neither technically, nor legally, nor in fact in Chechnya, according to the order and the federal law “On Military Mobilization.” A person who has become familiar with the material part of the legislation in this area will doubt such lofty and loud words; they do not inspire confidence and are not reflected objectively. Mass systemic forced mobilization is when all men from 18 to 60 years old are taken from every family, which Kadyrov really wants , but cannot achieve it due to the latent resistance of the Chechens. The applicant for asylum in Poland already contacted me last year because of this article, to whom I explained my position and also explained to his wife. Additionally, I assured the couple that I would provide a detailed certificate for the court and authorities, that those who were opponents of the dictatorship should not be returned to Chechnya because of the threat to their life and health. I asked their lawyer and his wife to write to me by email with an official request and documents, but, unfortunately, I never received the request.

For the future, I ask you to study in detail the material part of the legislation, read the articles carefully and in their entirety, and also know the tautology of terms for their correct use, and not misleading the public.

And I am always ready to openly discuss any issue both personally and remotely in open platforms. You can always write to me directly for an explanation. Caucasus. Realities Twenty months of losses: what is known about the 5,000 military personnel of the south and Caucasus killed in Ukraine On February 24, 2022 - twenty months ago - a full-scale invasion of Ukraine began. This war is costing Russia dearly: the authorities do not disclose...

description: Russian presidential candidate Vladislav Davankov from the New People party introduced a bill to the State Duma, allowing citizens to recall mayors through an annual secret ballot on the State Services portal. The bill requires at least 50% of votes to remove the mayor.
original:
🏛️Russian presidential candidate from the New People party Vladislav Davankov introduced a bill on the recall of mayors to the State Duma.

It is proposed to give citizens the right to recall heads of municipalities based on an annual secret ballot on the State Services portal. At least 50% of the votes will be required to remove the mayor.

Previously, Davankov proposed returning direct elections of mayors and reducing up to a third of officials in order to increase spending on education and medicine to 20% of GDP.

description: After months of fighting, Russian forces have captured the eastern city of Avdeevka, regaining the initiative in the conflict. Ukrainian troops are running low on ammunition and weapons, and political infighting in Western capitals is delaying supplies and aid.

“Russia has regained the initiative and put Vladimir Zelensky in a dead end. Russia's military conflict in Ukraine is now in its third year, with President Vladimir Putin's forces going on the offensive and, after months of fighting, capturing the eastern city of Avdeevka.✔️Amid the conflict, with momentum ebbing and flowing, the mood in Kiev is now noticeably gloomier. Zelensky replaced the military leadership amid disputes over the recruitment of new soldiers and battle strategy. His troops are running low on ammunition and weapons, and political infighting in Western capitals is delaying supplies and aid.✔️Millions of Ukrainians are still forced to flee their homes. The death toll remains the highest in any European conflict since World War II.✔️Russia is gaining momentum again. While the West is cutting off further aid to Kyiv, undermining its defenses, Russia is pushing ahead in eastern Ukraine. The Ukrainian military retreated from Avdiivka, giving the advancing Russian forces a major victory on the battlefield.”

description: Russian forces attempted a high-speed breakthrough of the enemy's defense in the Zaporozhye direction on February 22, 2024, but failed to take Rabotino immediately. Despite modest progress, the enemy's morale remained unbroken, and positional battles continue along the entire line of combat in the Orekhovsky sector.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Zaporozhye direction, situation on February 22, 2024 A high-speed breakthrough of the enemy’s defense in this area failed. It was not possible to take Rabotino at once. Yes, in general we have progress, but it is relatively modest, since the enemy was well prepared in this area and his morale was not broken by the fall of Avdeevka.

The Russian Armed Forces came close to Rabotino from the south and west, but they were unable to take the settlement (what was left of it). To the southwest of Rabotino, our fighters expanded the zone of control. Positional battles are taking place along the entire line of combat in the Orekhovsky sector.

original:
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

description: A study found that during Putin's fourth presidential term from 2018 to 2023, at least 116,000 people were prosecuted, surpassing the scale of repressions under Khrushchev and Brezhnev. The majority, 105,000, were convicted in administrative cases, while 11,442 were convicted under repressive criminal articles.
original:
“Project”: Putin surpassed Brezhnev and Khrushchev in the scale of repressions. In his last term alone, at least 116 thousand people were prosecuted. The project released a large-scale study of criminal and administrative cases brought to Russian courts from 2018 to 2023 - during Vladimir Putin's fourth presidential term - and compared the figures with the Soviet period under Nikita Khrushchev and Leonid Brezhnev. Journalists dedicated their text to Alexei Navalny.

As the publication found, over the past six years under Putin, 116 thousand people have been subjected to some form of persecution - this is the most conservative estimate. Of these, 5,613 Russians were tried under basic criminal articles, which human rights activists consider repressive (“fakes” about the army, extremism, justification of terrorism, and others).

If we also take into account those who refused to fight in Ukraine and those accused of treason, espionage and other repressive articles, we get 11,442 convicted. The remaining 105 thousand are convicted in administrative cases.

At the same time, during the years of Khrushchev’s rule, according to the state archives, 4,833 people were convicted under articles of “anti-Sovietism.” And over the following years, up to perestroika (from 1962 to 1985), another 3,234 citizens were persecuted.

“In terms of the scale of repression, Putin has long surpassed almost all Soviet general secretaries, except one - Joseph Stalin,” the researchers concluded. Infographics: “Project” Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: On February 17th, Russian forces launched an assault on Avdeevka, initially making easy progress in the private sector. However, they soon encountered Ukrainian units hiding in civilian homes and basements, threatening locals with execution if they refused to cooperate. The Russian military captured or neutralized the Ukrainian soldiers, liberating the city and earning the gratitude of the local population.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash in Donbass
The guys from "Fifteen" spoke in detail about the main event of February. And as a bonus, we shared our video blog from Avdeevka.

The morning of February 17th is the beginning of the assault. Progress in the private sector was easy. This aroused suspicion, but ours still went forward. Then the fighters began to stumble upon enemy units. It turned out that the Armed Forces of Ukraine dropped into the homes of civilians and hid in their basements. And those who refused were threatened with execution. As soon as ours noticed Ukrainian soldiers, they were captured or liquidated.

When the Russian military liberated the city, the people rejoiced and began sharing stoves and mattresses to make it easier to survive the cold nights. In response, the soldiers distributed their dry rations to local residents, who had to survive for a long time without humanitarian aid. At the same time, people said that the Ukrainian Armed Forces fled towards Novomikhailovka, abandoning the bodies of colleagues, the wounded and the last equipment. Subscribe to Mash in Donbass

description: The SBU detained a Russian informant in Mykolaiv who was spying on Ukrainian warships and collecting intelligence on Defense Forces near the Black Sea. The informant was gathering information on the coordinates of land units in the Kherson region to prepare missile and drone attacks. SBU employees neutralized the threat, securing the deployment of Ukrainian units and documenting the criminal actions of the informant.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian informant who was spying on the ships of the Armed Forces of Ukraine near the Mykolaiv seaport. Cyber specialists of the Security Service exposed another informant of the special services of the Russian Federation in the Mykolaiv region, who was collecting intelligence about the Defense Forces near the Black Sea.

Among the priority "targets" of the enemy were warships of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the directions of their movement by sea and river routes.

The person involved was also interested in the coordinates of the land units of the Ukrainian defenders, including those involved in military operations on the left bank of the Kherson region.

Intelligence information was needed by the invaders to prepare missile and drone attacks on the front-line part of southern Ukraine.

But SBU employees neutralized such a threat in a timely manner. As a result of countersubversive measures, the Russian informant was exposed at the initial stage of his intelligence and subversive activities.

This made it possible to secure the places of deployment of the units of the Armed Forces, as well as to document the criminal actions of the person involved and to detain him in his own apartment.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice turned out to be a local resident, whom the aggressor remotely engaged in cooperation at the beginning of this year.

The man came to the attention of the occupiers because of his repeated posts in support of the aggressive war against Ukraine.

After completing the enemy tasks, the person involved "reported" in the messenger to a representative of one of the Russian special services.

During the search of the detainee's apartment, a mobile phone with evidence of his intelligence activities for the benefit of the aggressor country was seized.

So far, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the defendant of suspicion under Part 3 of Art. 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (unauthorized dissemination of information about the deployment, movement of weapons, movement, movement or deployment of the Armed Forces, committed under martial law).

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces 12 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Mykolaiv region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

event: Draft Law on Strengthening Responsibility for Illegal Passenger Transport
description: The Law Enforcement Committee is working on a draft law to strengthen responsibility for violations of passenger transport procedures by road transport. The goal is to improve legal regulation and hold motor carriers accountable for transporting passengers without permits.
original:
🚌The Law Enforcement Committee is working on a draft law on strengthening responsibility for violations of the procedure for transporting passengers by road transport (No. 11025).The goal is to improve the legal regulation of the issue of bringing to responsibility motor carriers who transport passengers by bus without appropriate permits ("illegal" transportation).

The draft law proposes to make changes to the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses and the Law of Ukraine "On Motor Transport", which regulate issues related to the prosecution of the specified motor carriers.

The act contains provisions on supplementing the Code of Administrative Offenses with a new administrative offense (Article 16420), which introduces the administrative liability of drivers who carry out paid transportation of passengers by road transport without state registration as a business entity (illegal carriers). 📲Details

description: The Ministry of Transport plans to collect sensitive data from travelers, including IP addresses, bank cards, phone numbers, email addresses, and account passwords, to track and identify criminals, from smugglers to terrorists.
original:
The Ministry of Transport plans to collect data on IP addresses and bank cards of travelers. The department will oblige carriers to collect from people not only passport and ticket data, but also transfer information about bank cards, IP addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses and even account passwords to a single database. Kommersant writes about this. For what? According to the publication’s sources, this will help track and quickly identify criminals: “from smugglers to terrorists.”

Carriers, including airlines, consider that the requested data “is sensitive and cannot be collected by them” without additional consent from the passenger.

Nevertheless, the Ministry of Transport intends to implement such plans from September 1. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Travel from Denmark to Sweden across the Øresund Bridge reached a record high in 2023, with over 100,000 private trips made daily. Train travel saw the largest increase, while commuter passenger numbers are still lower than pre-pandemic levels. Freight traffic, however, slowed down compared to 2022.
original:
Travel from Denmark to Sweden at Øresund is at a record high, but freight travel is down. On average, more than 100,000 private trips were made across the crossing each day last year, according to Øresundsbronn, operator of the Øresund Bridge. Train travel has increased the most, according to the statement. among all types of trips.
Öresundsbron has identified what it says are three key trends in cross-strait traffic. These include: a record number of private car and train journeys across the Øresund Bridge, as well as a record number of ferry trips between Helsingborg and Helsingør; an upward trend in the number of commuter passengers but to a level still lower than in 2019, before the Covid-19 pandemic; a slowdown in freight traffic compared to 2022. In the fourth quarter of 2023, 19,351 trips were made daily, which is the busiest quarter for the transition in the 2016- 2023 The annual figure remains four percent lower than 2019.@VoiceNorthSea

description: Sweden's security agency, Säpo, warned of a threat from Russia to its territorial security, citing increased interest in the Arctic region as Sweden prepares to join NATO. Russia is also suspected of industrial espionage, with a rise in undercover agents from several countries.
original: Sweden warns of threat from Russia ahead of NATO membership. Sweden's security watchdog, Säpo, said in its annual threat assessment report on Wednesday that Russia poses a threat to its territorial security amid heightened interest in the Arctic as the Scandinavian country prepares to join to NATO. "Moscow is also increasingly posing an industrial espionage threat as Sweden has seen a rise in the number of undercover agents from several countries," Säpo said. Sweden has abandoned two centuries of military non-alignment and applied to join NATO after the start of the SVO in Ukraine in 2022 year. Stockholm expects Hungary, the latest holdout, to ratify its membership on Monday. Säpo noted that Russia, along with China, is “engaged in activities that threaten security in the very north of Sweden,” and membership of Sweden and Finland in NATO would expand the alliance's borders in the Arctic regions.@VoiceNorthSea

description: According to US Customs and Border Protection, over 7.2 million illegal immigrants entered the US during Biden's presidency. This number exceeds the population of 36 US states and would form the second-largest city in America if gathered together.
original:
7.2 million illegal immigrants entered the US during Biden's presidency.

The figure came from US Customs and Border Protection, which has already reported detecting 961,537 migrants at the border in the current fiscal year, which runs from October to September. If the current rate of illegal immigration does not slow, fiscal year 2024 will break last year's record of 2,475,669 migrants detected at the Southwest border — a number that alone exceeds the population of the border state of New Mexico.

The total number of migrants detected at the Southwest land border since Biden took office in 2021 is 7,298,486, according to US Customs and Border Protection. This is more than the population of 36 US states, such as: Alabama, Arkansas, Idaho, Colorado, Massachusetts, Wisconsin, Wyoming. If the number of illegal immigrants who entered the U.S. under President Biden were to gather together to form a city, it would be the second largest city in America after New York (and the most crime-ridden).

By the way, the specified number of illegals does not include approximately 1.8 million migrants who are known for sure to have evaded law enforcement, which is already more than the population of New York City. And unofficial sources generally claim about 12 million illegal migrants who entered the US territory during the presidency of Biden, which is almost equal to the number of migrants who arrived in the US during the two previous terms of the presidency of Trump and Obama.

More like suicide, or scenarios from books like The Coach Diaries by the respected professor William Luther Pierce. By the way, the theory of the "great replacement" of white people by colored migrants is still considered Nazi, and people who voice it are subject to persecution. @vallholl

description: Today marks the 1-year anniversary of the Ukrainian hacking team 'Cyber Resistance', which has been actively volunteering for Ukraine's benefit since 2014. They have made significant public and non-public contributions, with their public achievements documented on InformNapalm's website.
original:
Friends, we have great news for you! Today marks exactly 1 year since the day of creation of extremely powerful Ukrainian hacking team "Cyber Resistance".

These guys have been actively volunteering for the benefit of Ukraine since 2014 and participated in various projects. We have been personally acquainted with some of them for almost 10 years, so the very date of "1 year" is quite conditional and characterizes only the format in which they are currently participating.

During this fiery year, "Cyber Resistance" has already done a lot both publicly and not publicly. Books and films will probably be written about the non-public component of their activities after the victory in this war. But you can always familiarize yourself with their public achievements through exclusive materials on the website of the international intelligence community InformNapalm in the /hacker category. These CYBINT studies were published in 7-10 languages of the world and often caused important changes far beyond the borders of Ukraine.

Subscribe to "Cyber Resistance", they are part of the flame of truth🔥 that overcomes the darkness of Russian secrets and lies.

event: Discovery of Jehovah's Witnesses Extremist Materials
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol identified a location used by the banned Jehovah's Witnesses organization to promote extremist ideology. Over 5,000 books were confiscated, with half intended for distribution among school-age children. The literature contained propaganda promoting exclusivity and superiority based on social, racial, national, or religious affiliation. Financial reports revealed the organization's involvement in financing Ukrainian armed forces.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

The ideological content of the seized literature included elements of propaganda of the exclusivity and superiority of a person based on his social, racial, national, religious affiliation or attitude to religion.

Despite the expressed anti-war rhetoric of the organization’s doctrinal documents, during the analysis of the discovered financial reports, information was obtained about its involvement in the financing of Ukrainian armed forces.@PushilinDenis

Show more

Do not leave switched on household electrical appliances unattended.

Make sure the electrical wiring is in good condition.
Don't smoke in bed.
Your safety is your responsibility!

description: Protesters who laid flowers in memory of Navalny were issued summonses to the military registration and enlistment office. However, upon arrival, they were told the office was closed, and the summonses were deemed invalid due to lack of office number and mismatched timing.
original:
CHTDPhoto,😡Those detained for laying flowers in memory of Navalny are given summonses to the military registration and enlistment office.

At least sh...😑The military registration and enlistment office called the summonses issued to the participants of the rally in memory of Navalny “scarecrowers”. One of those who received such a summons came to the military registration and enlistment office of the Vyborg district of St. Petersburg, but was told through the intercom that the commissariat was closed. The summons issued to the man by the police was called a “scarecrow” - it does not indicate the office number, which means the piece of paper can be considered invalid. The documents also do not match the time of appearance: the summonses were issued at 9 am, and the military registration and enlistment offices open an hour later.

description: Dynamo volleyball club player Mikhail Pado reported Kuzbass volleyball player Nikita Kozlov to the police for fraud. Kozlov borrowed 636,000 rubles from Pado, claiming it was for his mother's treatment, but the mother was actually healthy. Kozlov failed to repay the debt and even created a fake social media account to deceive Pado.
original:
Dynamo volleyball club player Mikhail Pado reported the Kuzbass volleyball player to the police. He borrowed half a million rubles from him for the treatment of his mother, who is actually healthy.

20-year-old Nikita Kozlov and Mikhail Pado have known each other for quite some time. According to Mikhail, Kozlov often borrowed money from him: either for his mother’s treatment abroad, or for expensive medicines for himself. A colleague borrowed him 490 thousand without any problems, and then another 146 thousand. Kozlov did not return the money on time, but he did not disappear completely. For the last 2-3 months, he himself offered to meet about the debt, but at the last moment he pulled out.

Some time later, Kozlov’s sister wrote to Mikhail in Telegram. She promised: her brother would soon repay the debt and everything would be fine. The athlete first believed, and then checked - he began to look for her social networks and realized that the account from which they wrote to him was fake. Then he contacted Kozlov's real sister. She told the athlete that this was the first time she had heard about her mother’s illness.

There are probably other victims among the volleyball players - there are rumors that Kozlov borrowed money from other players, in total more than a million due to his gambling addiction.

description: A 32-year-old man died after being stabbed by his 52-year-old stepmother in the Orhei district. The incident occurred on February 20 in the village of Lopatna, following a conflict between the two.
original:
The stepmother stabbed her stepson in the Orhei district. The young man died in the hospital after a stab wound inflicted on him by his stepmother. The crime occurred on February 20 in the village of Lopatna, Orhei district, sources say.

According to sources, the deceased was a 32-year-old man. He, along with his 25-year-old partner, as well as a relative, went into the forest to perform certain work on a plot of land they owned, Pulsmedia reports.

The man went into the yard of his father, who lived in the same area, to take a horse and cart, and his relative and his partner were waiting for him on the street. After some time, the young man returned, holding his shoulder. He asked for help, his clothes were covered in blood.

A conflict arose between him and his stepmother, a 52-year-old woman, as a result of which the woman hit him with a kitchen knife.Notebook Moldova

event: Teacher Forced to Delete Wedding Photo
description: In the Novosibirsk region, a 25-year-old teacher, Marina Lvova, was forced to delete a 5-year-old wedding photo with her husband after a denunciation claimed it was of an 'intimate nature.' The regional Ministry of Education supported the denunciation, and the teacher was required to write an explanation, stating that she and her husband have been together for many years and are expecting a child.
original:
#chronicles_of a madhouse In the Novosibirsk region, after a denunciation, a teacher was forced to delete a wedding photo with her husband against the backdrop of a church. A denunciation was written to 25-year-old teacher Marina Lvova: the wedding photo was allegedly of an “intimate nature.” The regional Ministry of Education supported the denunciation and reported that a preventive conversation was held with the teacher, and the photos were deleted.

The woman had to write an explanation: the photographs are already 5 years old, she and her husband have been together for many years and are expecting a child.

description: A concert was held at the Novotroitsk Music School to celebrate the upcoming Defender of the Fatherland Day. Children and teachers performed musical works that honored the courage and bravery of soldiers who have served and are serving their country.
original:
A concert was held at the Novotroitsk Music School on the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day. Children and teachers of the children's music school performed at a concert dedicated to the upcoming holiday. Through musical works, the performers conveyed the courage and bravery of the soldiers who selflessly served and are serving their Motherland.

The concert was also attended by distinguished guests - the head of the local administration Kuzmenko, the head of the cultural department Shokareva and the chairman of the veterans council Kuchanskaya.

event: Assassination of Defector Pilot Maxim Kuzminov
description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who entered Spain under the alias Igor Shevchenko with a forged Ukrainian passport, was assassinated. The use of fake documents led to confusion in the Spanish media about the identity of the deceased.
original:
Forwarded from: Informant
The murdered defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov entered Spain under the name of 33-year-old Igor Shevchenko with a passport of a citizen of Ukraine issued on September 22, 2023, which is why there was confusion in the Spanish media about the identity of the liquidated man, since forged documents were found on the spot. Informant

Touching video
“Let me rise, my daughter,” Pyotr Zhuravlev did not see his daughter and granddaughter for two years and reunited with them after the liberation of Avdeevka.

description: On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, officers of the Investigative Directorate of the Investigative Committee of Russia in the Kherson region honored the memory of heroes who died in the struggle for freedom and independence. They laid flowers at the monument to the 'Unknown Soldier' in the city park named after Taras Shevchenko and observed a minute of silence.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee of the Kherson region
Officers of the Investigative Directorate of the Investigative Committee of Russia in the Kherson region honored the memory of the defenders of the Fatherland. On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, employees of the investigative department in the Kherson region honored the memory of the heroes who died in the struggle for the freedom and independence of our Motherland.

In the city park named after Taras Shevchenko, there is a monument to the “Unknown Soldier”, where the names of brave and valiant warriors are carved on the memorial plaque. Their exploits are immortal and forever inscribed in the history of our country. Having laid flowers, the officers of the Russian Investigative Committee honored the memory of the fallen with a minute of silence. Our task is to continue the just cause of our grandfathers and great-grandfathers, remember the merits of the Soviet people and preserve the great past of our country. Eternal glory to the Heroes!⚡Subscribe to the Investigative Committee of the Kherson region

description: Employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Russia in the Lugansk People's Republic rescued a cat from a fire in a residential building on Chekhov Street in Alchevsk. The cat, found huddled in the kitchen, had inhaled acrid smoke but was revived after being taken outside. The fire, caused by burning garbage on the sofa, was contained and destroyed a 0.5 square meter area.
original:
Employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Russia in the Lugansk People's Republic rescued a cat from a fire. Line 101 in Alchevsk received a message that there was heavy smoke in a residential building on Chekhov Street.
Upon the arrival of the duty guards of the 18th fire and rescue unit, smoke was coming from under the closed doors and from the windows of the house. During reconnaissance, it turned out that there were no owners, but in the smoke-filled kitchen, helplessly huddled in the corner, a white-and-red cat was sitting. The animal had inhaled acrid smoke and needed help. He was taken out into the fresh air, where the cat quickly came to his senses. Now nothing threatens the health of the furry fire victim. The source of the fire was in the living room on the sofa, the garbage was burning.
The fire destroyed a sofa covering an area of 0.5 square meters. m.

description: The Russian Baltic Fleet delivered humanitarian aid, including boxes of goods and fruit, to the Military Hospital in Pushkin. Volunteer girls also provided homemade cakes, creating a festive atmosphere for the children.
original:
Good day, friends! We tell you about everything as promised.

Today we were at the Military Hospital in Pushkin, with the soldiers who have been under the care of the Russian Baltic Fleet since its very foundation.

They delivered humanitarian aid: several boxes of things and boxes of fruit.

Special thanks to the volunteer girls for the delicious homemade cakes. It's a pity that the video and photo don't convey these amazing aromas.

For the children, through joint efforts with the Hospital administration, it was possible to create an atmosphere of a real holiday, with treats, congratulations, cards and letters from the children.

Once again we express our deep gratitude to everyone for their participation and help. We hope everything worked out for us🎆

description: Former Russian military pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who defected to Ukraine and crossed the war front in an Mi-8 helicopter, was shot dead in La Vila Hoyosa, Alicante, Spain. He had entered Spain with a genuine passport and a false identity card, allegedly provided by the Kiev government. The Spanish State Security is investigating the circumstances surrounding his death.
original:
Ukraine newsPhoto, False Ukrainian documents issued by the Ukrainian authorities to deceive the EU pilot Kuzminov. To the Spanish authorities he presented himself as Igor Shevchenko, but this was a fictitious name for the Ukrainian passport GG843153. In the document to which EL PERIÓDICO had access, he appears with his own physiognomy unchanged, with the bangs and facial features for which he became famous in Russia and Ukraine last August, he crossed the war front in an Mi-8 helicopter.

Former Russian military pilot Maxim Kuzminov, shot dead in La Vila Hoyosa (Alicante) on the 13th, entered Spain last October with a genuine passport and a false identity card.

The Spanish State Security is investigating whether the Kiev government provided him with a false identity card and who in Spain knew about this circumstance.

Depending on the answer to these questions, it will be possible to confirm that Spanish territory was used for executions related to the war in Ukraine, that is, there was a security failure with the refugee.

The manner in which the crime was committed is another important aspect. This is not in the spirit of the Russian special services, due to lack of professionalism: there were eight shots, two of them missed and one was not fatal. “An executioner from the GRU shoots you in the chest, and the other in the head and immediately disappears, using a previously prepared means of escape,”— explains one of the sources in State Security

It is likely that the judicial investigation will not clarify the key question in this case: whether the Russian deserter was in Spain with the knowledge of diplomatic leaders and defense departments. Writes El Periodico
